title: Angular momentum cons - omega of collapsed star

content.question: A spherical star spinning at an initial angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> suddenly collapses to half of its original radius without any loss of mass. Assume the star has uniform density before and uniform density after the collapse. What is the angular velocity of the star after the collapse?

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems
